abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Secondary and Local Roads Project is to improve access to
            essential services and economic markets, via the provision
            of all weather roads, for the resident population in the
            hinterland of the project roads. The requested reallocation
            is required to pay for an extension to the scope of the
            contract for consultant supervision, in terms of the number
            of road sections being reconstructed, within the program of
            reconstruction of secondary and local roads. This has been
            necessitated by the success of the project in leveraging in
            finance from other donors, and the corresponding increase in
            the number of construction contracts under implementation at
            any one time. The funds are available for reallocation as
            the work of the consultants procured with the project
            preparation advance was delayed, with some of the work
            taking place after effectiveness of the project.
